references.paper_title: Chain-of-thought prompting elicits reasoning in large language models
references.reason: This paper introduces chain-of-thought prompting, a foundational technique for improving reasoning capabilities in LLMs, which is directly relevant to the study of test-time scaling.
This paper introduces the o1 series of models and the concept of test-time scaling, the central focus of the current paper's investigation.
This paper explores self-revision in LLMs, a key mechanism affecting the performance of test-time scaling, directly addressed in the analysis.

references.paper_title: Scaling LLM test-time compute optimally can be more effective than scaling model parameters
references.reason: This paper explores different approaches to test-time scaling, including parallel and sequential, providing a comparative context for the current research.

references.paper_title: Deepseek-R1: Incentivizing reasoning capability in LLMs via reinforcement learning
references.reason: This paper introduces DeepSeek-R1, a model used in the study, offering valuable empirical data and insights into test-time scaling.
